00027 
00028 # This module includes
00029 
00030 ## @brief This function converts a string into an integer allowing
00031 #  operations (+, -, /, *).
00032 #  
00033 #  The formula is calculated and the output is returned by 
00034 #  the function. If the formula contains floating point 
00035 #  values or results they're converted into integer at the end.
00036 def textToInteger(text):
00037         chars=['+', '-', '/', '*', '.', '(', ')', ',']
00038         chars=chars + [str(x) for x in range(10)]
00039         text = text.replace(',', '.')
00040         try:
00041                 return int(eval(text))
00042         except:
00043                 return False
00044 
00045 ## @brief This function converts a string into a float allowing
00046 #  operations (+, -, /, *).
00047 #  
00048 #  The formula is calculated and the output is returned by 
00049 #  the function. 
00050 def textToFloat(text):
00051         chars=['+', '-', '/', '*', '.', '(', ')', ',']
00052         chars=chars + [str(x) for x in range(10)]
00053         text = text.replace(',', '.')
00054         try:
00055                 return float(eval(text))
00056         except:
00057                 return False
00058 
00059 ## @brief This function converts a float into text. By default the number
00060 # of decimal digits is 2.
00061 def floatToText(number, digits=None):
00062         if not number:
00063                 number = 0.0
00064         if digits:
00065                 # Digits might come from the server as a tuple, list or a string
00066                 # So: (14,2), [14,2], '(14,2)' and '[14,2]' are all valid forms
00067                 if isinstance(digits,list) or isinstance(digits,tuple):
00068                         d=str(digits[1])
00069                 else:
00070                         d=digits.split(',')[1].strip(' )]')
00071         else:
00072                 d='2'
00073         return ('%.' + d + 'f') % number
00074 
00075 ## @brief This function returns True if the given value can be converted into
00076 # a float number. Otherwise it returns False.
00077 def isNumeric(value):
00078         try:
00079                 return float(value) or True
00080         except (ValueError, TypeError), e:
00081                 return False
